code: library(gridmaker) library(sf)   # Load the sample data from the sf package nc_raw <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  # Define target projected CRS and cell size target_crs <- 5070 # NAD83 / Conus Albers cellsize_m <- 10000 # 10 km  # Project the data nc <- st_transform(nc_raw, target_crs)  # Create a grid covering the data nc_grid <- create_grid(   grid_extent = nc,   cellsize_m = 5000,   output_type = "sf_polygons",   clip_to_input = TRUE )  head(nc_grid, 3) Simple feature collection with 3 features and 5 fields Geometry type: POLYGON Dimension:     XY Bounding box:  xmin: 1570000 ymin: 1340000 xmax: 1600000 ymax: 1360000 Projected CRS: NAD83 / Conus Albers      id   X_LLC   Y_LLC                      GRD_ID_LONG GRD_ID_SHORT                       geometry 54   54 1580000 1340000 CRS5070RES10000mN1340000E1580000 10kmN134E158 POLYGON ((1580000 1340000, ... 55   55 1590000 1340000 CRS5070RES10000mN1340000E1590000 10kmN134E159 POLYGON ((1590000 1340000, ... 132 132 1570000 1350000 CRS5070RES10000mN1350000E1570000 10kmN135E157 POLYGON ((1570000 1350000, ... plot(st_geometry(nc_grid), border = 'grey20') plot(st_geometry(nc), add = TRUE, border = 'red', lwd = 2)

title: Create a high-performance, standard-compliant spatial grid — create_grid
code: create_grid(   grid_extent,   cellsize_m,   crs = NULL,   output_type = c("sf_polygons", "sf_points", "dataframe"),   clip_to_input = FALSE,   use_convex_hull = FALSE,   buffer_m = 0,   id_format = c("both", "long", "short", "none"),   include_llc = TRUE,   point_type = c("centroid", "llc") )

title: Create a high-performance, standard-compliant spatial grid — create_grid
text: grid_extent spatial object define grid's extent. Can sf sfc object, 2x2 bbox matrix, numeric vector c(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax). cellsize_m single integer representing grid cell size metres (e.g., 1000 1 km grid). crs coordinate reference system (CRS) output grid. Accepts various formats handled sf::st_crs(): integer numeric EPSG code (e.g., 3035), string representation like "epsg:3035", crs object. NULL (default), CRS inherited grid_extent. grid_extent also lacks CRS, function stop error. output_type class output object: "sf_polygons" (default) creates spatial object polygon geometries, "sf_points" creates sf object point geometries, "dataframe" creates data frame grid cell centroid coordinates (X_centroid, Y_centroid). clip_to_input logical value. TRUE, grid filtered include cells intersect grid_extent. cut cell geometries. use_convex_hull logical value. TRUE clip_to_input TRUE, grid clipped convex hull input geometry, can faster simpler using complex polygon. buffer_m numeric value. clip_to_input TRUE, specifies buffer distance metres apply grid_extent geometry clipping. Defaults 0 (buffer). id_format character string specifying grid cell IDs generate. Options "" (default), "long", "short", "none". include_llc logical value. TRUE (default), columns lower-left corner coordinates (X_LLC, Y_LLC) cell included output. point_type character string, used output_type = "sf_points". Determines location points: "centroid" (default) center cell, "llc" lower-left corner.

text: sf object (polygon point geometries) data.frame representing grid, optional columns coordinates INSPIRE-compliant grid IDs.
